attributes.title: The Secret of 'What Illumines Your Mind'
attributes.description:
"Paramahamsa Nithyananda decodes the 6th verse of Kena Upanishad, in the Nithya Satsang of 13th August 2016 from Bengaluru Aadheenam. Upanishad is repeating the truth at least 5 times, for this sacred secret is too important. 

yanmanasā na manute yenāhur-mano matam
tadeva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yadidamupāsate || 6 ||
“That which cannot be thought of by the mind with its modified functions of intellect, intelligence, contemplation, cognition; but by which, they say, the mind is able to think and cognize, being illumined by the light of infinite Cosmic Intelligence—you must know That very Source of Mind, That Reality alone as Brahman, the Absolute Existence, and not this which is worshipped and cherished here as a finite, limited object.”
He tells us to iron out the whole life with the truth of INFINITE. Let Infinite be the Source of life. Let the finite be the Source of your joy. Revealing the intricate details of the MIND or MANAS – “Your mind when it shows something good or bad, don’t get caught, even if you try to defend, it’s a trap. Don’t get trapped. Don’t even say – yes or no. Just be unclutched. Understand, when your mind says, you are failure, you are wrong, even if you are trying to solve that issue, you are trapped. No! LOOK WHO IS SHOWING YOU YOUR MIND. DON’T LOOK WHERE YOUR MIND IS SHOWING YOU. Not what your mind shows, but what shows your mind to you. 
Watch this video to learn the sacred secrets of ‘what illumines your mind.”"""
